Phil started with 50, and doubled this amount the next year for 50*2=<<50*2=1000>>1000 coins
Phil then collected 3 per month the following year, and since there are 12 months in a year that was 3*12=<<3*12=36>>36 coins added
Phil then collected 1 every third month, and since there are 12 months that means he collected one every 12/3=4 months, for 4 coins added
Before he lost a quarter of his coins, Phil had 1000+36+4 coins, or <<1000+36+4=1040>>1040 coins in total.
Losing a quarter of 1040 coins means Phill lost 1040/4=<<1040/4=260>>260 coins
That means Phil had 1040-260= <<1040-260=780>>780 coins remaining
